labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is focused on connecting to and interacting with Microsoft SQL Server databases. Its core functionality revolves around executing SQL queries and managing database connections, which are essential for data retrieval and manipulation. The tool provided ("query") allows users to run SQL commands directly on the database, indicating its primary use in database operations and data handling.
labels.reasoning: The primary label of "Database Operations" was chosen because the server's main functionality is centered around managing and querying databases. The secondary label of "Data Analysis & Processing" was selected because running SQL queries implies some level of data analysis and processing. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: query
tools.description: Execute a SQL query on a MSSQL database

server_info_crawled.name: MSSQL Database Connector
server_info_crawled.author: @knight0zh/mssql-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect to Microsoft SQL Server databases and execute SQL queries effortlessly. Manage your database connections and run queries directly from your applications with ease. Enhance your data handling capabilities with this powerful MCP server.

tools.name: query
tools.description: Execute a SQL query on a MSSQL database

connectionString.description: Full connection string (alternative to individual parameters)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "port": 1433,
  "encrypt": false,
  "database": "master",
  "trustServerCertificate": true
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@knight0zh/mssql-mcp-server/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
